page.title: 01East Mendip
page.content: Limestone Quarrying.This is the third larges quarry in Britain. Adjoining land may be arable or dairy farmed. Much of it being quarry owned. The 3 mile deep wooded valley accommodates the ralway line from this establish- ment linking it with the main line at Frome. Eight trains per day carry approx 1000 tons per journey. New stonecrusher being installd which will have a capacity of crushing 2000tns. per hour. Further reserves of stone are estimated at 250 million tonnes. Screening and crushing processing in excess of 2 million tonnes per annum. There are 92 manual workers plus 8 managerial staff employed here excluding contract drillers ad haulage contractors. All are local residents. Much is done to camaflage and reimburse wildlfe, plants etc by grassing of banks and tree
